info.name: av_microservice_finance
info.description:
Finance m/s for processing and tracking lending of Airtime, MoMo, and Data

Release Notes

VersionDetail
5.0.149Logging issues fixed when logging all even though set to error.
5.0.132Deprecated queued advance state (statusId=6)
DevOps, this requires renaming fn_cancel_unconfirmed_queued to fn_cancel_unconfirmed_advances in the scheduler job
5.0.131Introduced deactivationdate in subscriber column to track when sub was churned
5.0.130Reconcile endpoints are now only allowed to update advance and payment date once
5.0.114Optional sourceId parameter on addRepayment
Optional updatedExternalRef parameter on reconcileAdvance
reconcilePaymentConsolidated response includes previous reconciled minutely status
5.0.108First release

Introduction

The Finance micro-service exposes end points to add loans, add repayments, and a number of other features required to run and manage a lending system.
Notes on the SETTING table:
Below is a list of important entries in the setting table
ItemExample valueDescription
SOURCE_OF_TRUTH1If the MNO is the source of truth, we record the payment records as we receive it (1 - MNO; 2 - AV) - meaning the entire payment amount is allocated to the oldest open advance if the advanceid was not supplied. If AV is the source of truth, payments are allocated to open advances from the oldest advance first to the most recent
REPAY_ORDER3,2,1The order payments are allocated per advance to the different charges. I.e. 3,2,1 means interest (3) is paid first, then service fee(2), and lastly the advance portion(1)
URL_DOSENDSMShttp://127.0.0.1:81/doSendSMSThe URL for sending SMSes created in the interest notification and collection messages jobs
LENDING_CEILING1000The total currency value of open advances that a subscriber can have at any given time
Notes on collection messages (bad debt/payment reminder messages):
Single open loans:fn_send_collection_messages
- outstanding amount on the loan
- the date that the loan is due
- total value of the loan
- how many days the loan is overdue

Multiple open loans:fn_send_collection_messages_open_to_buy
- the total amount of all loans that is/will be due on the given day
- date when the loans will be due on the given day
- how many days loans are overdue
- how many days before due date is reached
- the total amount of loans that is still outstanding

1 - CDR (minute/hour/interval) 2 - DAILY (daily recon process) 3 - Loan payment reconciliation 4 - Service fee payment reconciliation
(Required) This is the third party/operator's transaction ID.
When given, will save the timestamp from the CDR file for this advance, into the cdrtimestamp column

request.description: This endpoint is used to reconcile multiple payments that have the same paymentTransactionId. This will then flag a payment or more than one payment with the same paymentTransactionId as having been reconciled. This can be done if a secondary source of truth (DCR records, etc) can confirm that the payment was in fact successfully recovered. The source determines what type of reconciliation we are processing, for online reconcilation of payments the value of 1 would be used. For offline reconciliation a 2 would be used. If the payments are split into two records, we would use 3 and 4 for loan and service fee payments respecitvely. in the latter 2 scenarios the values will be stored as binary values indicating the reconciliation state. 0: The default state, indicating that both types have not been reconciled 1: Indicates that the service fee payment has been reconciled 10: Indicates that the loan payment has been reconciled 11: Indicates that the loan payment and service fee payment has been reconciled Partial payments will always show a reconciliation state of 1 or 10. Note: It also updates the statusid to 2 - Success

query.description: 1 - CDR (minute/hour/interval) 2 - DAILY (daily recon process) 3 - Loan payment reconciliation 4 - Service fee payment reconciliation

third party paymentId

request.description: Flags a payment as having been reconciled. This can be done if a secondary source of truth (DCR records, etc) can confirm that the payment was in fact successfully recovered. The end-point flags the entry in the Lending micro-service's payment table as having been reconciled. This reconcilaition can be performed using either the third party's paymentTransactionId or Airvantage's paymentId. The source determines what type of reconciliation we are processing, for online reconcilation of payments the value of 1 would be used. For offline reconciliation a 2 would be used. If the payments are split into two records, we would use 3 and 4 for loan and service fee payments respecitvely. in the latter 2 scenarios the values will be stored as binary values indicating the reconciliation state. 0: The default state, indicating that both types have not been reconciled 1: Indicates that the service fee payment has been reconciled 10: Indicates that the loan payment has been reconciled 11: Indicates that the loan payment and service fee payment has been reconciled Partial payments will always show a reconciliation state of 1 or 10. Note: It also updates the statusid to 2 - Success

item.name: Returns a consolidated view of payments for multiple open advances.

query.description: (Required) This is the transaction ID that the operator will use for a payment, AV's paymenttransid in this microservice should correlate to that of the operator.
(Required) This is a unique identifier of a subscriber.

request.description:
This endpoint is used on sites where AV offers multiple open loans as a feature to the subscriber and will report on all unconfirmed payments. Status ID are:
 1 - Unconfirmed Payment was recorded, but we haven't received an ACK from the IN that it was processed on the telco's side yet) 2 - Confirmed (Payment was recorded, and an entry in the CDRs confirmed that amount was paid over) 3 - Cancelled (Payment was recorded, and after we failed to receive an ACK from the IN, was cancelled)

query.description: (Required) This is the transaction ID that the operator will use for a payment, AV's paymenttransid in this microservice should correlate to that of the operator.
(Required) This is a unique identifier of a subscriber.

 1 - Unconfirmed Payment was recorded, but we haven't received an ACK from the IN that it was processed on the telco's side yet) 2 - Confirmed (Payment was recorded, and an entry in the CDRs confirmed that amount was paid over) 3 - Cancelled (Payment was recorded, and after we failed to receive an ACK from the IN, was cancelled)

item.name: Returns a summarised version of the advance status for this subscriber.

query.description: (Required)

request.description:
Response includes an entityTypeX

[ entityType1 / entityType2 / entityType3 ] 0 - Open loan
1 - Loan is presently being queued
2 - No outstanding loan
The response also includes totalrepaybalance

totalrepaybalance = totaladvancebalance + totalservicefeebalance

Overdue: If "overdue" = true in the response, it means that there is an unpaid open advance that is past the due date.

Queued: If "queued" = true in the response, it means that there is an advance that is in a queued state and currently being processed.

Note: This call gets cached if 'PROF_CACHE_LIVENESS_SECONDS'>0
In other words, calling the endpoint with the same query parameters within the 'PROF_CACHE_LIVENESS_SECONDS', will not access the DB again, but will simply return the previously generated http response.

item.name: Changes MSISDN whilst retaining subscriber history.

request.description: This endpoint is used to update the suscriber table in the lending microservice, whenever there is a change in the subscriber's msisdn

item.name: Deactivates this subscsriber.  Future references to this MSISDN will create a new subscriber.

query.description: (Required)

request.description:
Marks the current subscriber associated with this MSISDN as inactive and creates a new subscriber. All subsequent transactions against the MSISDN will be linked to a newly created subscriber. Note:
For the sake of optimal performance, this end-point does not bother checking for the existence of an MSISDN before trying to churn it. It simply updates the subscriber, setting the status to INACTIVE for the given MSISDN (if it exists).

The statusId that the payment must be inserted with.

request.description:
Adds a repayment (full/partial) towards a loan/advance.

There are 3 payment allocation strategies:
1. Advanceid was supplied in the request - The payment will only be allocated to this one advance.
2. Advanceid was not supplied and AV is source of truth (see setting table) - The payment will be allocated to multiple advances, from oldest to most recent.
3. Advanceid was not supplied and MNO is source of truth (see setting table) - The payment will be allocated to the oldest open advance only.
Note:
If an advance id was supplied, then if that advance is in status 1 (unconfirmed) or status 3 (cancelled) that receives a payment, it will be updated to status 2 (confirmed)

query.description: Amount to allocate to the msisdn / advance id - Takes precedence over the loanAmt and serviceAmt. So if this parameter is supplied, its value will be used instead of the values of loanAmt and serviceAmt

Amount being allocated to repaying the service fee portion. This will be deprecated and replaced by the amount parameter.

item.name: Adds a charge against the specified advance.

query.description: (Required) Amount to allocate to the msisdn / advance id
(Required) The amount will be allocated to the advance with this advance id
(Required) The type of charge i.e 1 = advance, 2 = service fee, 3 = interest
The date of the charge. If omitted, the current time will be used. in the format yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss

The amount of terms over which the amount needs to be applied, if used the amount will be divided by the terms. the resultant value will be rounded up and the last term rounded down. Each result will be inserted into the charge table with a 30 day payment term added to each record. Starting from the chargeDate plus 30 days, if the charge date is not applied the caurrent date will be used i.e current date plus 30 days.

Each result will be inserted into the charge table with a 30 day payment term added to each record. Starting from the chargeDate plus 30 days, if the charge date is not applied the caurrent date will be used i.e current date plus 30 days.

request.description:
Adds a new loan/advance for a given MSISDN.
Returns an advanceID in the JSON response.
Note:Subsequent calls to repay this loan (/addRepayment) will require this advanceID. If the advanceId is NOT specified, the payment will go towards paying off the oldest advance.

Ignoring duplicate addAdvance requests: A mechanism exists to ignore requests that are exactly the same and are received within a certain amount of time from each other. CACHE_LIVENESS_SECONDS can be set to specify how many seconds the same request should be ignored if it is already received previously.
